output.summary: Samsung Electronics is a global leader in semiconductor, telecommunication, digital media, and digital convergence technologies. Recognized as one of the leading global brands, Samsung Electronics is a major producer of digital TVs, memory chips, mobile phones, and TFT-LCDs.

SK Hynix is a South Korean memory semiconductor supplier of dynamic random-access memory (DRAM) chips and flash memory chips. It is the world's second-largest memory chipmaker and the world's third-largest semiconductor company.

Hyundai Motor Company is a South Korean multinational automotive manufacturer headquartered in Seoul, South Korea. Hyundai vehicles are sold in 193 countries through some 5,000 dealerships and showrooms.

Samsung Electronics Preferred Stock offers a higher dividend yield compared to common stock but usually lacks voting rights. It represents equity ownership in Samsung Electronics with priority in dividend payments.
LG Energy Solution is a global leader in delivering advanced lithium-ion batteries for Electric Vehicles (EV), Mobility & IT applications, and Energy Storage Systems (ESS).

Samsung Biologics is a biotechnology company headquartered in Songdo, Incheon, South Korea. The biotech division of Samsung Group, it provides contract development and manufacturing (CDMO) services to the biopharmaceutical industry.
SK Square is an investment company spun off from SK Telecom. It focuses on investing in future ICT technologies such as semiconductors, media, security, and commerce.
Hanwha Aerospace is South Korea's only aircraft engine manufacturer and a total defense solution provider. It produces engines for various aircraft and space launch vehicles.
Kia Corporation is a South Korean multinational automobile manufacturer. It is South Korea's second-largest automobile manufacturer after its parent company, Hyundai Motor Company.
Doosan Enerbility involves in the manufacturing and construction of nuclear power plants, thermal power stations, turbines and generators, desalination plants, castings, and forgings.
HD Hyundai Heavy Industries is the world's largest shipbuilding company. Its diverse business lines include shipbuilding, offshore and engineering, and engine and machinery.
Samsung C&T Corporation is a construction and engineering company. It operates through Engineering & Construction, Trading, Fashion, and Resort groups.
KB Financial Group is a leading financial services provider in Korea offering a broad range of financial products and services including personal banking, insurance, and asset management.
Celltrion is a biopharmaceutical company headquartered in Incheon, South Korea. It specializes in researching, developing, and manufacturing biosimilars and innovative drugs.
Shinhan Financial Group is one of Korea's leading financial institutions, providing a comprehensive range of financial services including banking, credit cards, securities, and insurance.
Hanwha Ocean is a global shipbuilding and offshore engineering company. It specializes in building LNGCs, ultra-large container ships, and offshore plants.
NAVER Corporation is South Korea's leading internet company. It operates the search engine Naver and provides services including Line messenger, webtoon, and SNOW.

Korea Electric Power Corporation (KEPCO) is the largest electric utility in South Korea. It is responsible for the generation, transmission, and distribution of electricity and the development of electric power projects.
Hyundai Mobis forms the 'parts and service' arm for the South Korean automakers Hyundai Motor Company, Genesis Motors, and Kia Motors.
Samsung Life Insurance is the largest life insurance company in South Korea. It provides a variety of life insurance products and financial services.
Korea Zinc is a world-class general non-ferrous metal smelting company. It produces zinc, lead, copper, gold, silver, and indium.
Hana Financial Group is a major South Korean financial holding company. It provides a wide range of financial services to individual and corporate customers.
HD Hyundai Electric is a leading manufacturer of electrical equipment. It produces power transformers, high-voltage circuit breakers, and rotating machinery.
Samsung SDI is a battery and electronic materials manufacturer. It produces small and large-sized Li-ion batteries for IT devices, automobiles, and ESS.
POSCO Holdings contains POSCO, a multinational steel-making company. It has expanded into non-steel sectors including trade, engineering, and construction.

HD Korea Shipbuilding & Offshore Engineering is the sub-holding company of HD Hyundai's shipbuilding business. It controls Hyundai Heavy Industries, Hyundai Samho Heavy Industries, and Hyundai Mipo Dockyard.
Mirae Asset Securities is a leading investment banking and stock brokerage company in South Korea. It offers wealth management, investment banking, and potential investment services.
Kakao Corp. is a South Korean Internet company. It owns KakaoTalk, the country's most popular messaging app, and offers a wide range of mobile services.
Samsung Heavy Industries is one of the largest shipbuilders in the world and one of the 'Big Three' shipbuilders of South Korea. It focuses on high-tech and high-value vessels.
SK Inc. is the holding company of SK Group. It is involved in energy, telecommunications, and semiconductor businesses through its various subsidiaries.
